title: About
text: My name is Pratham Kancherla and I am a sophomore at The Ohio State University. My major is Computer Science & Engineering and I am proficient in Python, Java, R, HTML.

title: About
text: My name is Pratham Kancherla and I am a sophomore at The Ohio State University. My major is Computer Science & Engineering and I am proficient in Python, Java, R, HTML.

title: About
text:
About My Project
This project will focus on analyzing each of the 5 positions in basketball, the PG (Point Guard), SG (Shooting Guard), SF (Small Forward), PF (Power Forward), C (Center), and finding the position with the best average FT%. The dataset I will be using can be found here.
Feel free to contact me through my email, pratham.kancherla@gmail.com.
This project was created as a part of Kane’s Data Science Bootcamp.

title: Model

library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.2     ✔ readr     2.1.4
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.0
✔ ggplot2   3.4.2     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.2     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.1     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(rstanarm)

Loading required package: Rcpp
This is rstanarm version 2.21.4
- See https://mc-stan.org/rstanarm/articles/priors for changes to default priors!
- Default priors may change, so it's safest to specify priors, even if equivalent to the defaults.
- For execution on a local, multicore CPU with excess RAM we recommend calling
  options(mc.cores = parallel::detectCores())

library(ggplot2)


c_stats<- read_csv("data/C_stats.csv")|>
  filter(MIN >=20)|>
  arrange((`FT%`))

Warning: One or more parsing issues, call `problems()` on your data frame for details,
e.g.:
  dat <- vroom(...)
  problems(dat)


Rows: 141 Columns: 18
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (3): Player, Team, Positions
dbl (15): PTS, REB, AST, BLK, STL, FG%, FT%, 3PM, TO, GP, MIN, FTM, 2PM, A/T...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

fit_obj_c <- stan_glm(data = c_stats,
                    formula = `FT%` ~ 1,
                    family = gaussian,
                    refresh = 0,
                    seed = 9)
fit_obj_c

stan_glm
 family:       gaussian [identity]
 formula:      `FT%` ~ 1
 observations: 60
 predictors:   1
------
            Median MAD_SD
(Intercept) 0.7    0.0   

Auxiliary parameter(s):
      Median MAD_SD
sigma 0.1    0.0   

------
* For help interpreting the printed output see ?print.stanreg
* For info on the priors used see ?prior_summary.stanreg
